name: Adrift in Golden Bay

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We spent christmas here and had a wonderful time. the attention to detail is amazing, even down to beach towels already packed in a basket. Gordon and Bess are very helpful but also unobtrusive, and we really enjoyed the well equipped cottage and beautiful sorroundings. The laundry facilities are so convenient . The only (very slight) reservation we had is that the bed settee which my daughter slept on wasn't terribly comfortable. Over all we loved Adrift and can't wait to return.
reviews.title: All you could wish for in a beach retreat

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2010, traveled with family
reviews.text: We stayed for one night in December. Our hosts were very welcoming! It was raining when we arrived so we were disappointed that we couldn't walk on the beach. They loaned us a movie and we were quite comfortable staying in this beautiful cottage right on the beach. The bathroom was amazing with the spa bath. Breakfast provisions were nice as well. My only suggestion: stay more than one night as all of the actitvities take half a day to complete. We drove the entire south island and didn't allow enough time to really enjoy the beauty of this place. I can't wait to come back to the south island and we will definitely be staying here again.
reviews.title: What a beautiful spot!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Adrift in Golden Bay is awesome. If you can afford it and have time, stay 3 nights at minimum. The cabin is beautiful, contemporary and with a deluxe spa bathroom. Request the cabin with the best ocean views. The kitchen is complete in case you are tired of eating out or want to cook an English breakfast (all the ingredients are provided to you). The private beach is just steps away. Gordon, who owns Adrift with his wife, is a tremendous source of information and advice and is charming and genuine. Hikes both short and long begin nearby, including hikes in Abel Tasman national park and several other short hikes that are interesting because there is a destination, e.g., an old gold mine. Whether you are on a long or short trip, do not miss a stay at Adrift. Would be a great honeymoon place ! or a place to regroup during an extended stay in NZ.
reviews.title: Beautiful ocean views, beautiful private cottage, wonderful hosts, total relaxation, and great hiking nearby.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: All the praise heaped on Adrift is 100% well deserved--this small beachfront cottage operation run by Gordon and Bess is pure magic.
reviews.title: Superlatives are well deserved

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We spent three days here while exploring the more remote areas of the South Island. Getting out to this spot 18 kms from Takaka takes some faith that there will be a pot of gold at the end of the rainbow; a long lane winding through a farm field before you pull up to the cottages and owners' house. Then you are led to your immaculate cottage on an exquisitely private beach; the rainbow reward indeed is here.
reviews.title: A little piece of paradise

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2011, traveled with friends
reviews.text: one of the most soul searching places i have ever been to. The hosts are lovely, and the view from the rooms are simply stunning! love it, and dream of it to date! I would love to go back there someday and spend a whole month. The view is simply spectacular, the endless sea, the blue waters, are so inviting. i could close my eyes during a hectic work day and just imagine i am there, and i already feel better. a must go! a must see.
reviews.title: Heaven on earth

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Only had 2 days at this divine place and it just flew by. Walking virtually alone on the beach early morning was a delight. It truly is a bit of paradise on earth, well worth the trip over the 'hill' for!. Everything was just superb in the cottage, the bathroom being to die for! Immaculate in every way. Just loved the area too, We did not allow enough time in our trip for this area, would have loved more. hard to judge from the uk how long to allow in each place.
reviews.title: Brilliant, relaxing, Paradise Indeed

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: It is expensive, I don't think we paid more on our five week trip but it was a lovely treat for ourselves! Splash out if you can.
reviews.title: ‘Push the boat out’ to stay here, you won't regret it!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: You’ll need to ‘push the boat out’ to stay here but it’s worth it, you won’t be disappointed. Adrift has the ‘wow’ factor! Gordon and Bess and their family will give you a warm welcome and their lovely individual cottages, which are very well appointed, are located in a secluded spot within yards of the beach and have wonderful views of the Tasman Sea – you feel as if you have your own private beach. Very romantic and suitable for all ages. The very popular evening venue – Mussel Inn, is highly recommended. Farewell Spit is a relatively short drive away and there are many beautiful bays and beaches in the area with Wharariki probably top of the list – worth the walk. This was probably our favourite stay during our month long tour of both Islands.
reviews.title: Paradise on Earth

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We were a little taken aback when we turned off the main road to Collingwood towards Adrift to see a sign for a campground as we thought we were booked into a remote beachside bungalow within acres of ground. UNFOUNDED worries.
reviews.title: Outstanding location with great cottages and friendly service

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The guide book said that possibly the only drawback with Adrift might be that you wouldn't want to leave. It wasn't far off the mark. With so much beauty to see in NZ (and particularly South Island) choosing our itinerary for our holiday from the UK was always going to difficult. Having read about the beachside setting and after reading the family's website we had high hopes. We arrived after a long drive under grey skies but knew immediately we'd made the right decision. The accommodation is faultless, the setting perfect and the atmosphere totally relaxing. For the next 3 days we had the beach virtually to ourselves as we explored, under blue skies. It is no surprise that the family have been here nearly 30 years. Gordon & Bess were a delight to know and will help you with anything you need (thanks again for the use of the laptop, Gordon!)
reviews.title: Absolutely perfect!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My husband and I spent three days here in November for our honeymoon and LOVED our stay! We stayed in an ocean view unit, which was beautifully decorated, spacious, had a very comfortable bed and had a very relaxing atmosphere. the food provided to us for breakfast was fantastic. We loved the toasted granola and homemade yogurt. In the evening, we made great use of the gas grill outside. On the sunny days, we enjoyed walking on the beach and hiking to Pupu Springs and the the Pupu Hydropower facility (you can hike along narrow water flumes and get great views of the valley). On our rainy day, we stayed inside and made use of the extensive collection of DVDs. All-in-all, as soon as we left we wanted to make plans to go right back! While it's a little bit of a drive, staying here is 100 percent worthwhile!
reviews.title: Tranquil and Adventurous!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2011
reviews.text: Fabulous rooms and facilities, beautiful breakfasts, charming hosts
reviews.title: Beautifully appointed cottages, ideal for getting away from it all

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We chose to stay here based on the many good reviews on TripAdvisor, actually changing our travel plans to allow an extra night here, and we were not disappointed.
reviews.title: Simply the best there is

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This is an outstanding place to stay at. It is off the main road and very close to the sea, which makes for a lovely setting. The sound of the sea is ever-present and a great sound to wake up to in the mornings. The hosts are really thoughtful and their attention to detail is faultless. The staff are friendly and the standard of the accommodation is absolutely on the top line.
reviews.title: Perfect

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Adrift is a small development of half a dozen well equipped chalets situated only 20m from a beautiful beach. Each chalet is self-contained and completely private. If you want quiet, perfect relaxation then Adrift will suit. The family owners are thoroughly pleasant, welcoming and helpful with advice and help in booking local attractions - we took the recommended Farewell Spit 4 hour tour which was excellent.
reviews.title: Seaside Perfection

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2012
reviews.text: The only slight drawback is that the nearest bar/restaurant (the excellent Mussel Inn) is a 10 minute drive away so self catering becomes a distinct option.
reviews.title: Amazing view

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Adrift is an outstanding experience and thoroughly recommended.
reviews.title: Is there a rating category 'above excellent'?

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed in the studio and it was wonderful to sit on the deck and see the sea at both the end and the start of the day
reviews.title: Be prepared to stay content in your Bungalow - Cos you wont want to anywhere else!!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Lovely breakfast hamper each day a real joy eating breakfast on the deck
reviews.title: Romantic getaway

aka: Adrift In Golden Bay Hotel Takaka
description: A 5-Star, self-contained accommodation situated on a quiet, sandy and sheltered private beach. The 5 cottages and a studio are spread over 1 Ha of landscaped gardens to ensure guest privacy and a peaceful, relaxed and romantic atmosphere. All accommodations have king-size beds with breathtaking views over Golden Bay. The stylish, modern interiors feature warm timbers. Cottages all have luxury double spa baths. Centrally located between Abel Tasman, and Kahurangi National Parks and Farewell Spit Nature Reserve. This beautiful area is well known for artisans, interesting cafes and varied day walks
